THE GLORY OF
AMERICAS
CLIPPER SHIPS
recaptured
BY PAN AMERICAN
Those nim note a sipious caper in
the history of America's sea trade. Then came
steam, and gone was America's supremacy
on the seven seas
Today, however, that supremacy is being
recaptured by a new kind of clipper ship.
Today, an even more glorious chapter is
being written-by Clipper Ships that fly.
Pan American Clippers are America's swift
ambassadors of trade over 65,000 miles ol
airlanes, linking 55 countries, colonies and
islands. They bring brand-new trade oppor-
tunities and travel goals
within days and
even hours of every point in the U.S.
Pan American blanes already have flowr
1,425,000 persons a total of 530,000,000
miles: have carried many thousand tons of
express cargo and mail. Just as this country':
proud boast once was its merchant marine
of the sea, so today the world envies amer
ica's Merchant Marine of the Air—the Flying
Clippers.
You can get complete passenger details at
any travel bureau or transportation line
office; express information at any Railway Ex-
press agency; air mail data at
any post office —and all three
at any Pan American office. TRUST FLY
PAA
PAN AMERICAN AIRWAYS SYSTEM
AMERICA'S MERCHANT MARINE OF THE AIR
ROUTES OF THE FLYING CLIPPER SHITO
properties.sfomuseum:description: Advertisement from Saturday Evening Post promoting Pan American Airways System, titled “The Glory of America’s Clipper Ships Recaptured by Pan American”; color illustration depicting Boeing 314 seaplane in flight over sea with sail ship in background.
